meanings.definition: Engaging in controversial debate or argument
meanings.sent1: The polemicizing discussion at the meeting led to heated disagreements.
meanings.sent2: Her polemicizing remarks sparked a lively debate among the audience.
meanings.sent3: The polemicizing tone of the conversation made everyone stop and listen.
meanings.sent4: His polemicizing style of argumentation was like a fiery storm of words.
meanings.sent5: The polemicizing nature of the debate left a lasting impression on the participants.

meanings.definition: Writing or speaking in a strongly critical or aggressive manner
meanings.sent1: The author's polemicizing against the government policies caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: Her polemicizing in the article was met with mixed reactions from readers.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's polemicizing about everyday life situations added humor to the show.
meanings.sent4: The politician's polemicizing on the campaign trail was like a verbal battle.
meanings.sent5: The journalist's polemicizing style made the news reports more engaging.
